intro: Rhynchospora rugosa var. griffithii, commonly known as the Griffith's rough sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flower heads. It typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, preferring moist, sandy soils. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
